snippet: The authority of Commissioner Roger Goodell to enforce the N.F.L.’s player conduct policy was a subject of discussion at a meeting of team owners.
abstract: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell meets with league’s team owners for first time since release of video showing former Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice in violent domestic dispute with his fiance Janay Palmer; in remarks following meeting, Goodell reports that a full revamping of policies related to his power to enforce personal conduct policy governing player malfeasance is underway but will not be ready for months.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and RICHARD SANDOMIR

lead_paragraph: The authority of Commissioner Roger Goodell to enforce the N.F.L.’s player conduct policy was a subject of discussion at a meeting of team owners.

headline.main: N.F.L. Owners May Limit Powers of Roger Goodell
headline.print_headline: Owners May Limit Powers of Goodell
